means: 预知，预见( foresee的过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: These developments were foreseen in embryo more than a decade ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些发展早在十多年前的萌芽阶段就已预见到。

sentence.Network_en: I hadn't foreseen the tempest my request would cause.
sentence.Network_cn: 我没有料到我的请求会掀起这么大一场风波。

sentence.Network_en: The incident sparked off a whole series of events that nobody had foreseen.
sentence.Network_cn: 那一事件引发出一连串谁都没有料到的事。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...interesting B．meaningful C．accessible D．successful55．A．foreseen（预见） B．decidedC．judged D．formed
成人英语三级：阅读理解解题技巧 ... 3.dramatic 引人注目的，突然的 4.foreseen 预见的，预知的 5.reluctant 不情愿的，不愿意的.
no one has foreseen this sudden ambush ., 无人预知这场突如其来的偷袭.
we are taking fire , i should have foreseen this ., 我们遭受攻击 , 我该预见到的.

list.abs: be as the professor had foreseen ., 事情正如教授所预见的那样.
foreseen是什么意思... ... foreseen beneficiaries ： 受益人 foreseen problem ： 预先考虑问题 it be foreseen that ： 可以预料.
不能强制履行 unenforceable不能预知 not foreseen不能实行 inoperative
no one has foreseen this sudden ambush ., 无人预知这场突如其来的偷袭.

entry.def: If you foresee something, you expect and believe that it will happen.

example.ex: He did not foresee any problems...
example.tran: 他没有预见到任何问题。

example.ex: ...a dangerous situation which could have been foreseen...
example.tran: 原本可以预见到的危险情况

auth_sentence.content: Trends can be foreseen but not spikes and timing.
auth_sentence.res_content: Trends can be foreseen but not spikes and timing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Trends can be foreseen but not spikes and timing.

auth_sentence.content: But the wobble now should have been foreseen.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the wobble now should have been foreseen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the wobble now should have been foreseen.

auth_sentence.content: Kafka...an amazingly prescient political writer who had foreseen...totalitarianism.
auth_sentence.res_content: Kafka...an amazingly prescient political writer who had foreseen...totalitarianism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Kafka...an amazingly prescient political writer who had foreseen...totalitarianism.
